## P12.Method1 - eigen-decomposition

$xP = x \Rightarrow P^t x^t = x^t \Rightarrow 1 \cdot x^t$


```{python p12}

import numpy as np

P = np.array([.7, .5, .3, .5]).reshape((2,2), order="F")
values, vectors = np.linalg.eig(P.transpose())

print(values)
print(vectors)

x_1 = vectors[:,0] # get first column
v = x_1 / sum(x_1)

print(v)

```


## P15.Method2 - system of linear equation

```{python p15}

import numpy as np

P = np.array([.7, .5, .3, .5]).reshape((2,2), order="F")
n = P.shape[0]
I = np.eye(n)

A = np.c_[P-I, np.array([1] * n)]
b = np.array([0] * n + [1]).reshape((1, n+1))
v = np.linalg.solve(A.dot(A.transpose()), A.dot(b.transpose()))

print(v)

```


## P17.cont.

```{python p17}

import numpy as np

P = np.array([.7, .5, .3, .5]).reshape((2,2), order="F")

for i, power in enumerate([1,2,3,4,20]):
    # print("<", i+1, "th w/", power, ">")
    print(np.linalg.matrix_power(P, power))

```


## P19.Limiting probabilities

```{python p19}

import numpy as np

P = np.array([0, 1, 1, 0]).reshape((2,2), order="F")

for i, power in enumerate([2,3,4,5]):
    # print("<", i+1, "th w/", power, ">")
    print(np.linalg.matrix_power(P, power))

```
